title: Walk from Blakeney to Salthouse Walking Route

nearby.description: Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path

images.title: Ian Capper / Cley Marshes
images.caption: Cley Marshes Norfolk Wildlife Trust reserve. On the right can be seen the North Hide, on the skyline the tower of St Nicholas's Church, Blakeney and towards the left can be seen Cley Mill.

images.title: David Robertson / Salthouse Marshes
images.caption: Salthouse Marshes from Little Eye, with Salthouse village in the background.

images.title: Ralph / Salthouse
images.caption: Salthouse looking inland across the salt marsh

images.title: Reiner Tegtmeyer / Salthouse, après-marches walk
images.caption: Salthouse village from the garden of the Dun Cow pub.

images.title: Salthouse St Nicholas' church by Adrian S Pye, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Salthouse St Nicholas' church

description: This walk follows a section of the Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path from Blakeney to Salthouse. The route runs for just over 6 miles, following a flat, waymarked footpath. On the route there's some lovely coastal scenery with views towards Blakeney Point and the Cley Marshes Nature Reserve. The reserve consists of 430 acres of reed beds, freshwater marsh, pools and wet meadows. Look out for lots of water loving wildlife as you make your way along the path. These include seals, avocet, western marsh harriers, Eurasian bitterns and bearded reedlings. In Salthouse you could pay a visit to the noteworthy St Nicholas' church. The medieval church dates to the 1200s and sits in a fine location on a hill, offering splendid views along the coast and out to sea.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Dun Cow in Salthouse is a great place for some post walk refreshments. They do good food and have an interesting interior with wood beams and an exposed brick fireplace. Outside there's a lovely garden area with fine views over the Salthouse Marshes. You can find the inn on Purdy Street at a postcode of NR25 7XA. The pub is also dog friendly if you have your canine friend with you.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Blakeney Circular Walk starts from the car park in the village and explores the surrounding coast and countryside. It's a good way of visiting some of the highlights of the area including the other little villages and nature reserves.

display_address: SPAR, 7-9, Westgate Street, Blakeney, North Norfolk, Norfolk, England, NR25 7NQ, United Kingdom
